numlitem.para: Autobrake selector remains in the OFF position,
Autobrake solenoid valve is verified closed, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.

placard.para: Placard near Autobrake Selector Switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
To verify the Autobrake solenoid valve is closed:

numlitem.para: Apply electrical power to aircraft, chock the wheels, set parking brake OFF, and pressurize hydraulic system No. 4 (auxiliary pump or a ground pressure source may be used).
Place the AUTOBRAKE SELECTOR SWITCH to the OFF position.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message is no longer displayed, the solenoid valve is closed.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message remains displayed on EICAS at this point, either an electrical malfunction or a solenoid valve malfunction is indicated. Continue with the next step.
Open and collar the P180 panel AUTOBRAKES circuit breaker.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message is no longer displayed, a valve malfunction is not indicated and the valve is assumed to be closed.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message remains displayed on EICAS, continue with the next step.
Depressurize Hydraulic Systems No. 1, 2 and 4, then pump the brake pedals until the brake accumulator pressure gauge on the Captain’s panel will reduce no further (approximately 750 psi).
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message remains displayed, a solenoid valve pressure switch or indication system malfunction is indicated, and the solenoid valve is closed.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message is no longer displayed, the solenoid valve has failed open. Refer to MEL 32-42-3-2 for dispatch.
